availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ezekiel E. Garrett (Montgomery County, Kentucky, court clerk)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Teacher in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk of the Montgomery County Court from 1860 to 1862. Owned one enslaved person in Montgomery County in 1860. Clerk of the Montgomery County Court in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, p. 53.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery, Mount Sterling, p. 311.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery, Mount Sterling, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mt. Sterling, p. 306.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, KY: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 308.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862, Legislative Document Series, No. 24 (Frankfort, KY: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 304.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 12.
